metadata.title: CVE-2017-3464 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server component of Oracle MySQL (subcomponent:Server: DDL). Supported versions that are affected are 5.5.54 and earlier,5.6.35 and earlier and 5.7.17 and earlier. Easily "exploitable"vulnerability allows low privileged attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.3 (Integrityimpacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.18-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

libmariadbclient18 - 10.1.24-5
libmariadbd18 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-client-core-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-common - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-connect - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-spider - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-plugin-tokudb - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-server-core-10.1 - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-test - 10.1.24-5
mariadb-test-data - 10.1.24-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.18-0ubuntu1').
mariadb-10.1 package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.1.24-5').
